timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText:
Hum, I am not sure to understand.
Do you mean that some condition must be added ?
If the process us being destroyed, it is not an issue if the permission is not granted, no ?
replies.author: dgeranton

replies.bodyText:
I believe I'm mistaken. I've had a look through the docs, and it seems that View.addView won't throw under these circumstances.
Android has the concept of Activities. In AnkiDroid, each activity represents a screen. and an activity has a lifecycle outside of the process.
https://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/Activity
In some cases (mostly fragments), performing UI-based actions after Activity.onDestroy() will throw an exception. Our default exception handler is set to log and kill the process, so we want to avoid and recover from exceptions whenever possible.
replies.author: david-allison-1

timeline.bodyText:
We need to be consistent with this.

Preferences show "ifRoom", here shows "never".

I'd be tempted to use "never" and change the preferences/layout.xml. Users can increase the priority if they desire.
@mikehardy - does this seem sensible?
timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText: Good catch - they definitely need to match, 'never' for new features is the correct default on the app bar buttons - it makes the new feature opt-in. That reminds me - can you propose an edit here https://github.com/ankidroid/ankidroiddocs/blob/master/manual.asc#action-bar-2 to match? We don't do a great job of keeping the manual up to date because we forget mostly 😅  - this is a cool feature though and this might be the only way people find out about it
replies.author: mikehardy

replies.bodyText:
Ok, so if I understand well, I keep SHOW_AS_ACTION_NEVER.
Here is a text proposition for the manual:
Check Pronunciation
This action enables or disables the temporary audio recorder tool bar at the top of the card. This feature allows you to record your voice and replay it. It is useful to self checks your own pronunciation. This tool bar is composed of three buttons to : play, stop playing and record audio from microphone. This tool can be used at any time either during question side or than answer side.
